diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Combined inherited and acquired thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, neurologic and renal injury, coupled with a history of tick bites and Lyme disease. Initial laboratory findings pointed towards hemolysis, with the eventual presence of schistocytes supporting TTP as the leading diagnosis. The inconsistent test results for ADAMTS13 activity and antibodies indicated both inherited and acquired forms of TTP.
